result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence and as to count two.

Probation to run concurrent as to each count.
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING January 16, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Court waived supervison and assessments fees with the exception of two DNA, two domestic abuse and the mandatory court fees.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Obtain GED/HSED.
No contact with the victim(s) unless approved by the  Court or agent.  There shall be third party contact for the purposes of time with children as approved by the agent.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention program (BIP).
Attend parenting classes with a successfuly completion.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: 60 days as to each count:  Stayed pending review hearing.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count one and any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy M Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent also in Court.   Defendant progressing on Probation.  No further requires are requested.

Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction to run consecutive to any other sentence, and as to Count 2, with credit for 107 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction to run consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence.


Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS to run concurrent as to each count.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS condition day, as to each count, IMPOSED AND STAYED at the House of Correction pending a Review Hearing in Branch 23 on 01-16-2015.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO PROBATION:
*  Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program (BIP)
*  Attend Parenting classes with a successful completion
*  AODA assessment and treatment
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
*  Random urine screens.
*  Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent
*  No contact with the victim(s) unless approved by the Court or agent.
*  There shall be 3rd party contact for the purposes of time with children as approved by the agent
*  Obtain and maintain employment
*  Obtain and GED / HSED
*  Court WAIVED supervision and assessments fees with the exception of 2 DNA, 2 Domestic Abuse, and the mandatory court fees.

Received and filed with court:
*  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
All conditions and Justice Point Monitoring Remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail converted to a Signature Bond, all conditions remain the same.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Received & Filed, Amended Information: Count 1 Remains the same. Count 2 Amended to: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor. Paties have reached a resolution in this matter.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Parties reqest case be set for Plea Hearing prior to Jury Trial date. Case set for 7/31/2014 at 8:30 am in branch 23.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Joseph E Schubert in court, defendant Jeremy M Anderson not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced.  Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial. State's offer is open until 7/30/2014. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 08/06/2014.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List & State's Motion In Limine.

Attorney Joseph E Schubert in court, defendant Jeremy M Anderson not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy M Anderson
Current: 2872 N 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210-1821 United States  (Effective: 05-15-2014)
Prior: 8571 North 106th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Kevin Gaulke. Received in to evidence, state's exhibits # 1, 2 & 3.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. State withdrew exhibits # 1, 2, & 3. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJA W., Marquetta D. and Joscelyn W.

Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in court with Trisha Fritz who appears under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Jeremy M Anderson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant withholds plea as to misdemeanor count 1.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
